recommended_movies: The Spy Who Came in from the Cold (1965)

simulated_ratings.title: [The Third Man (1949)]
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody postwar intrigue and a bittersweet entanglement pulled me right in.

simulated_ratings.title: [Double Indemnity (1944)]
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, cynical, and seductive—the doomed scheme tension never lets up.

simulated_ratings.title: [Out of the Past (1947)]
simulated_ratings.feeling: That tug-of-war between a quiet life and old sins hooked me from the start.

simulated_ratings.title: [The Big Sleep (1946)]
simulated_ratings.feeling: Loved the hard-boiled vibe even if the maze of blackmail and bodies is more fun than clear.

simulated_ratings.title: [Rififi (1955)]
simulated_ratings.feeling: The meticulous heist and ruthless fallout had me white-knuckled.

simulated_ratings.title: [Kiss Me Deadly (1955)]
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mean, pulpy momentum with a nasty streak I enjoyed more than I should.

simulated_ratings.title: [Notorious (1946)]
simulated_ratings.feeling: Romance and espionage intertwine with delicious unease, though the duty-versus-desire pull kept me a bit cool.

simulated_ratings.title: [Shadow of a Doubt (1943)]
simulated_ratings.feeling: Small-town warmth curdling into suspicion is my kind of slow-burn chill.

simulated_ratings.title: [The 39 Steps (1935)]
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breezy wrong-man thrills across the countryside keep the pace snapping.

simulated_ratings.feeling: An epic pursuit with a troubling undercurrent that kept me absorbed but uneasy.
